intro: Borreria aturensis, commonly known as the Mexican broom, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-white flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Borreria aturensis is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
